questions.question: Where is Wembley Stadium located?
questions.explanation: Wembley Stadium is a major sports venue located in London.

questions.question: Which sports originated in Britain?
questions.explanation: Cricket, football, tennis, golf, and rugby all began in Britain.

questions.question: How many times has the UK hosted the Olympic Games?
questions.explanation: The UK hosted the Olympics in 1908, 1948, and 2012.

questions.question: Who founded the Paralympic Games movement?
questions.explanation: Dr Sir Ludwig Guttman started the Paralympic movement at Stoke Mandeville Hospital.

questions.question: Where was the main site of the 2012 Olympics?
questions.explanation: The 2012 Olympics were mainly held in Stratford, East London.

questions.question: Who was the first man to run a mile in under four minutes?
questions.explanation: Sir Roger Bannister achieved this feat in 1954.

questions.question: Which competition is played between England and Australia in cricket?
questions.explanation: The Ashes is a famous cricket series between England and Australia.

questions.question: Which is the UK’s most popular sport?
questions.explanation: Football is the most popular sport in the UK.

questions.question: When did England’s men’s football team win the World Cup?
questions.explanation: England won the FIFA World Cup in 1966.

questions.question: When did England’s women’s football team win the European Championships?
questions.explanation: England’s women’s team won the European Championships in 2022.

questions.question: Which competition includes England, Ireland, Scotland, Wales, France, and Italy?
questions.explanation: The Six Nations is a rugby union championship involving these countries.

questions.question: Where is the National Horseracing Museum located?
questions.explanation: It is located in Newmarket, Suffolk.

questions.question: Where is considered the home of golf?
questions.explanation: St Andrews in Scotland is known as the home of golf.

questions.question: What is the only ‘Major’ golf tournament held outside the USA?
questions.explanation: The Open Championship is the only Major held outside the USA.

questions.question: Where is Wimbledon held?
questions.explanation: Wimbledon takes place in London at the All England Club.

questions.question: Who was the first person to sail solo around the world?
questions.explanation: Sir Francis Chichester achieved this in 1966/67.

questions.question: Which race takes place yearly between Oxford and Cambridge?
questions.explanation: The Boat Race is a rowing contest on the Thames between Oxford and Cambridge.

questions.question: When did motor-car racing begin in the UK?
questions.explanation: Motor racing in the UK began in 1902.

questions.question: Who became the first Briton to win the Tour de France?
questions.explanation: Sir Bradley Wiggins won the Tour de France in 2012.

questions.question: Where is Europe’s longest dry ski slope located?
questions.explanation: Europe’s longest dry ski slope is near Edinburgh.
